docs.title: Welcome to the PHASES Assessment Schema Documentation
docs.text: This site provides documentation for the data schemas used in the Promoting Health Aging Through Semantic Enrichment of Solitude Research (PHASES) project.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Our goal is to create consistent, findable, accessible, interoperable, and reusable (FAIR) data models for the assessment instruments used in our research. These schemas are built using the LinkML framework.

From these source YAML files, we automatically generate: * This documentation website * JSON-Schema files for data validation * OWL/RDF artifacts for semantic web integration

docs.title: Available Assessment Schemas
docs.text:
Here are the schemas for the different assessment instruments. The documentation for each is automatically generated from its source LinkML file.

  • Yaden Self-Transcendent Experience Scale (STE-S)

    • Description: Documents the schema for the STE-S (State, Trait-Transformative, and Trait-Often versions) developed by Yaden et al.
    • Source File: src/schema/yaden_schema.yaml

  • ASTI Schema

    • Description: Documents the schema for Adult Self-Transcendence Inventory (ASTI) Assessment.
    • Source File: src/schema/asti_schema.yaml

  • STE Schema

    • Description: Documents the schema for Self-Transcendence Experience (STE) Trait - Often Assessment Schema.
    • Source File: src/schema/ste_schema.yaml

  • NEIS Schema

    • Description: Document the schema for Noetic Experiences and Integration Scale (NEIS) instrument.
    • Source File: src/schema/neis_schema.yaml

docs.title: Project Repository
docs.text: The source code, including the LinkML schema files, is available on our GitHub Repository.

docs.title: Enum: ASTILikertScale
docs.text:
A 4-point Likert scale from 'Disagree Strongly' (1) to 'Agree Strongly' (4) used in the ASTI. Values are numeric strings.

URI: asti:ASTILikertScale

docs.title: Permissible Values
docs.text: Value Meaning Description 1 NCIT:C103506 Disagree Strongly 2 NCIT:C91291 Disagree Somewhat 3 NCIT:C91292 Agree Somewhat 4 NCIT:C91293 Agree Strongly

docs.title: Slots
docs.text: Name Description asti_item_1 Response to: I am more likely to engage in quiet contemplation asti_item_2 Response to: I feel that my individual life is a part of a greater whole asti_item_3 Response to: I have become less concerned about other people's opinions of me asti_item_4 Response to: I feel that my life has less meaning asti_item_5 Response to: I am more focused on the present asti_item_6 Response to: I feel a greater sense of belonging with both earlier and future... asti_item_7 Response to: My peace of mind is not so easily upset as it used to be asti_item_8 Response to: I feel more isolated and lonely asti_item_9 Response to: I am less interested in seeking out social contacts asti_item_10 Response to: My sense of self has decreased as I have gotten older asti_item_11 Response to: My sense of self is less dependent on other people and things asti_item_12 Response to: I do not become angry as easily asti_item_13 Response to: I take myself less seriously asti_item_14 Response to: I have less patience with other people asti_item_15 Response to: I find more joy in life asti_item_16 Response to: Material things mean less to me asti_item_17 Response to: I am less optimistic about the future of humanity asti_item_18 Response to: I feel much more compassionate, even toward my enemies

docs.title: Induced
docs.text:
name: NEISAssessment
description: An assessment instance using the Noetic Experiences and Integration Scale
  (NEIS).
from_schema: https://w3id.org/example/neis_assessment_schema
attributes:
  assessment_id:
    name: assessment_id
    description: Unique identifier for this specific NEIS assessment instance.
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/example/neis_assessment_schema
    rank: 1000
    slot_uri: schema:identifier
    identifier: true
    alias: assessment_id
    owner: NEISAssessment
    domain_of:
    - NEISAssessment
    range: string
    required: true
  subject:
    name: subject
    description: The person who is the subject of the NEIS assessment.
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/example/neis_assessment_schema
    rank: 1000
    slot_uri: schema:subjectOf
    alias: subject
    owner: NEISAssessment
    domain_of:
    - NEISAssessment
    range: Person
    required: true
  assessment_date:
    name: assessment_date
    description: Date when the NEIS assessment was conducted or data was recorded.
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/example/neis_assessment_schema
    rank: 1000
    slot_uri: schema:dateCreated
    alias: assessment_date
    owner: NEISAssessment
    domain_of:
    - NEISAssessment
    range: date
    required: true
  responses:
    name: responses
    description: The complete set of responses provided by the subject for this NEIS
      assessment.
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/example/neis_assessment_schema
    rank: 1000
    alias: responses
    owner: NEISAssessment
    domain_of:
    - NEISAssessment
    range: NEISResponses
    required: true
  total_score:
    name: total_score
    description: Total calculated score for the NEIS assessment. The method for calculation
      (e.g., sum of item scores, handling of any reverse-scored items if they existed)
      would be defined by the instrument's scoring guidelines.
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/example/neis_assessment_schema
    rank: 1000
    slot_uri: schema:result
    alias: total_score
    owner: NEISAssessment
    domain_of:
    - NEISAssessment
    range: integer
    required: false
  evaluator:
    name: evaluator
    description: Person who administered, scored, or evaluated the NEIS assessment
      (if applicable).
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/example/neis_assessment_schema
    rank: 1000
    slot_uri: schema:performer
    alias: evaluator
    owner: NEISAssessment
    domain_of:
    - NEISAssessment
    range: Person
    required: false
class_uri: schema:MedicalTest

docs.title: Enum: NEISLikertScale
docs.text:
A 6-point Likert scale used in the NEIS instrument, ranging from '1 - Strongly Disagree' to '6 - Strongly Agree'.

URI: neis:NEISLikertScale

docs.title: Permissible Values
docs.text: Value Meaning Description 1 None Strongly Disagree 2 None Disagree 3 None Slightly Disagree 4 None Slightly Agree 5 None Agree 6 None Strongly Agree

docs.title: Slots
docs.text: Name Description neis_item_1 Response to: I appreciate the value of all my experiences neis_item_2 Response to: It pains me to think about dreams and goals l have had that I di... neis_item_3 Response to: I have accomplished everything I wanted to in my life neis_item_4 Response to: Life is meaningful neis_item_5 Response to: I wish I had loved more in my life neis_item_6 Response to: I have reached a point where I can accept the events in my life ... neis_item_7 Response to: As I grow older, I understand people more neis_item_8 Response to: I am bothered by mistakes I have made in the past neis_item_9 Response to: I have done exactly what I wanted to with my life neis_item_10 Response to: I see a meaningful thread running through the many events in my ... neis_item_11 Response to: Had I been born with a different personality, life would have be... neis_item_12 Response to: I can face death gracefully neis_item_13 Response to: Even my sufferings have had meaning neis_item_14 Response to: I wish I had more time to take a different path in life neis_item_15 Response to: As I get older, my life story makes more sense to me

docs.title: Schema Source
docs.text: • from schema: https://w3id.org/example/neis_assessment_schema

docs.title: Adult Self-Transcendence Inventory (ASTI) Assessment Schema
docs.text:
LinkML schema for capturing data from an instance of the Adult Self-Transcendence Inventory (ASTI). The ASTI assesses self-transcendence by comparing current feelings to those of five years ago.

URI: https://w3id.org/phases/assessment/gerotranscendance/asti

Name: asti-assessment-schema

docs.title: Classes
docs.text: Class Description ASTIAssessment An assessment instance using the Adult Self-Transcendence Inventory ASTIResponses The set of responses to the 18 questions in the ASTI instrument for a single ... Person A person involved in the assessment, either as the subject being assessed or ...

docs.title: Slots
docs.text: Slot Description age Age of the person in years at the time of assessment or when recorded assessment_date Date when the assessment was conducted assessment_id Unique identifier for this specific ASTI assessment instance asti_item_1 Response to: I am more likely to engage in quiet contemplation asti_item_10 Response to: My sense of self has decreased as I have gotten older asti_item_11 Response to: My sense of self is less dependent on other people and things asti_item_12 Response to: I do not become angry as easily asti_item_13 Response to: I take myself less seriously asti_item_14 Response to: I have less patience with other people asti_item_15 Response to: I find more joy in life asti_item_16 Response to: Material things mean less to me asti_item_17 Response to: I am less optimistic about the future of humanity asti_item_18 Response to: I feel much more compassionate, even toward my enemies asti_item_2 Response to: I feel that my individual life is a part of a greater whole asti_item_3 Response to: I have become less concerned about other people's opinions of me asti_item_4 Response to: I feel that my life has less meaning asti_item_5 Response to: I am more focused on the present asti_item_6 Response to: I feel a greater sense of belonging with both earlier and future... asti_item_7 Response to: My peace of mind is not so easily upset as it used to be asti_item_8 Response to: I feel more isolated and lonely asti_item_9 Response to: I am less interested in seeking out social contacts evaluator Person who administered or evaluated the assessment (if applicable) gender Gender of the person name Full name of the person person_id Unique identifier for a person (subject or evaluator) responses The complete set of responses provided by the subject for this ASTI assessmen... subject The person who is the subject of the assessment total_score Total calculated score for the ASTI assessment after accounting for reverse-s...

docs.title: Enumerations
docs.text: Enumeration Description ASTILikertScale A 4-point Likert scale from 'Disagree Strongly' (1) to 'Agree Strongly' (4) u...

docs.title: Types
docs.text: Type Description Boolean A binary (true or false) value Curie a compact URI Date a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar DateOrDatetime Either a date or a datetime Datetime The combination of a date and time Decimal A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal speci... Double A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification Float A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification Integer An integer Jsonpath A string encoding a JSON Path Jsonpointer A string encoding a JSON Pointer Ncname Prefix part of CURIE Nodeidentifier A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model Objectidentifier A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model Sparqlpath A string encoding a SPARQL Property Path String A character string Time A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular... Uri a complete URI Uriorcurie a URI or a CURIE

docs.title: yaden-ste-assessment-schema
docs.text:
LinkML schema for capturing data from instances of the Self-Transcendent Experience Scale (STE-S). The STE-S operationalizes Self-Transcendent Experiences as transient moments of decreased self salience and/or increased feelings of connectedness. Includes State, Trait-Transformative, and Trait-Often versions.

URI: https://w3id.org/phases/assessment/self-transcendence/ste
